wikipedia_page.main: Sarah Murray, née Maze (1744 – 5 November 1811) was an English travel writer, best known for her Companion and Useful Guide to the Beauties of Scotland (1799). She published under the name The Hon. Mrs. Murray, of Kensington, though after her second marriage she was also known as Sarah Aust.

response: * Sarah Murray (travel writer) (1744–1811), English travel writer
* Sarah Murray (priest) (born 1970), Scottish Episcopal priest and Provost of Inverness Cathedral
* Sarah Murray (ice hockey) (born 1988), ice hockey player and coach
